item.title: Report E-2024090200
item.description:
Report E-2024090200

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: SMITHFIELD
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver noticed the bottom of the IBC was wet during pre-trip inspection and checking the load. The package was removed and repacked into a new IBC and it was found the the inner liner had a small tear in it and it allowed about 8oz of liquid to escape.

item.title: Report E-2024090090
item.description:
Report E-2024090090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: SHELBYVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When facility personnel was checking the lot they noticed that there was liquid dripping form trailer. The facility has a ER team on there so they were able to contain and quickly address the release. Absorbent was put down to collect ay that made it to the ground. They then proceeded to unload the trailer to gain excess to the leaking container cleaning up any material along the way. They then put the drum into a salvage drum and disposed of the absorbents in the appropriate manner. The clean up took about an hour and was completed by 1700.

item.title: Report E-2024090088
item.description:
Report E-2024090088

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: SHELBYVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When a team member was inspecting trailer dropped on lot it was found that one of the trailers had liquid dripping from it. This facility houses one of our ER team so the response was quick. The trailer was unloaded and any material that was released was cleaned up with absorbents and then disposed of in the appropriate manor. The drum was discovered to have a hole in it believe to be punctured by a pallet. The clean up was completed in about an hour.
